issues.description:
Multiple sends exist in one transaction, try to isolate each external call into its own transaction. As external calls can fail accidentally or deliberately.
Consecutive calls: 
Call at address: 1392
issues.title: Multiple Calls

issues.description:
A possible integer overflow exists in the function `getNextPayoutEstimation()`.
The addition or multiplication may result in a value higher than the maximum representable integer.
issues.title: Integer Overflow

issues.description:
In the function `payEntryFee()` the following predictable state variables are used to determine Ether recipient:
- block.timestamp
issues.title: Dependence on predictable environment variable

issues.debug:
SOLVER OUTPUT:
timestamp: 0xffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffff
storage_4: 0xffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffd5cf
retval_828: 0xffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffff
callvalue: 0x38d7ea4c68000
calldata_EthBird_0: 0x7037ec6f00000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000
calldatasize_EthBird: 0x4
issues.description:
In the function `payEntryFee()` a non-zero amount of Ether is sent to an address taken from storage slot 1.
There is a check on storage index 1. This storage slot can be written to by calling the function `payEntryFee()`.

There is a check on storage index 4. This storage slot can be written to by calling the function `payEntryFee()`.
issues.title: Ether send

issues.description: A possible transaction order independence vulnerability exists in function payEntryFee(). The value or direction of the call statement is determined from a tainted storage location
issues.title: Transaction order dependence
